definition: (bound form used in 忙碌[mang2 lu4], 勞碌|劳碌[lao2 lu4], 庸碌[yong1 lu4] etc)

sentences.english: The growers are busy day and night, with harvest smile on his face.
sentences.chinese: 果農們日夜忙碌，臉上帶着豐收的微笑。

sentences.english: However, in a word, for the hard-working men, every minute is precious.
sentences.chinese: 但總而言之，對於忙碌工作的人，有時一刻就值千金。

sentences.english: Instead the neighborhood would best be described as hectic and smelly.
sentences.chinese: 這隻能概括爲忙忙碌碌和臭烘烘。

sentences.english: First, they have been rather busy.
sentences.chinese: 首先，它們已經相當忙碌了。

sentences.english: Americans on the go also tend to eat a lot of "junkfood.
sentences.chinese: 忙碌的美國人也趨向於喫一大堆“垃圾食物”。

sentences.english: As a youth, I choose to live a busy and meaningful life.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個青年，我寧願過忙碌而有意義的生活。

sentences.english: Our culture teaches us that being busy equals happiness.
sentences.chinese: 我們的文化課老師教導我們忙碌即幸福。

sentences.english: So to not to greedy butterfly, only small bees busy all day.
sentences.chinese: 所以招引不來貪心的蝴蝶，只有小蜜蜂整日的忙碌着。

sentences.english: When the bees busy dancing in the flowers, the adults are busy in the land.
sentences.chinese: 當蜜蜂飛舞在花間忙碌時，大人也在土地裏忙個不停。

sentences.english: Life was busy for Ka Wah at HKUST.
sentences.chinese: 嘉華在科大的生活非常忙碌。

sentences.english: Laure Shang was spotted getting busy for promo work for a brand.
sentences.chinese: 最近，中國歌手老何尚在爲品牌升級工作而忙碌。

sentences.english: After a difficult day at the office, Greta came home and began cooking dinner.
sentences.chinese: 在辦公室過完忙碌的一天，格里塔回到家開始做飯。

sentences.english: With our hectic lifestyles, a night of perfect and comfortable sleep seems like the ultimate reward.
sentences.chinese: 完善的夜間睡眠是對忙碌工作的最佳獎勵。

sentences.english: On busy Resurrection Sunday, Jesus took time out to find Peter.
sentences.chinese: 在復活的那個忙碌的星期天，耶穌還記掛着彼得。

sentences.english: The urban life of high-tempo is permeating with various desire and vainness .
sentences.chinese: 忙碌的都市生活，總是充滿了種種的慾望與無奈。

sentences.english: This is Shibuya crossing in Tokyo, rumored to be the busiest pedestrian intersection in the world.
sentences.chinese: 這是京都涉谷區，傳說是世界上最忙碌的十字路口。

definition: to be busy rushing about/to bustle about
exhausting/hard/tough/arduous/to work hard/to go to a lot of trouble/hardship(s)
to rush about/to be constantly on the move
lit. to continuously revolve/to work non-stop/to work around the clock (idiom)
to leave early and return late (idiom)
